metadata.title: CVE-2023-3355 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
A NULL pointer dereference flaw was found in the Linux kernel'sdrivers/gpu/drm/msm/msm_gem_submit.c code in the submit_lookup_cmdsfunction, which fails because it lacks a check of the return value ofkmalloc(). This issue allows a local user to crash the system.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-3355` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-5.15.0-75-generic - 5.15.0-75.82
linux-image-5.15.0-75-generic-lpae - 5.15.0-75.82
linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-75-generic - 5.15.0-75.82
linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-75-generic-64k - 5.15.0-75.82
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1035-kvm - 5.15.0-1035.40
No subscription required

No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-75.82').
linux-hwe-5.19: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'superseded by linux-hwe-6.2, was pending [5.19.0-45.46~22.04.1]').
